content.description: Short and steep, with big holds and fun moves, The Whining cranks out the center of the wall, just left of the crack through the roof. Harder for the shorter (or easier for the tall).

The bouldery crux is before the first bolt so stick clip it if you have any sense. There's a great jug above the bolt but don't get too comfy until you're standing on the ledge. After that it's 5.9 the rest of the way for 3 more bolts

The bouldery start is harder on taller folk and is probably V3 or V4ish
content.location: The start is under a cave toward the right of the wall. Right of The Snag and left of The Carnivore

content.description: Starts on ledge left of The Whining
Start left of Top That Direct (5.10b).
content.protection: Tricky gear near the small roof...

content.description: Once again passing the  first bolt is the crux. It stays with you for most of the way after the crux at 5.11.
content.location: the right most route on Hidden wall proper. Right next to Carnivore. Lower or rappel off anchors.

content.description: There is a distinctive crux passing the first 2 bolts. The roof pull is tough but the over all crux is getting to the anchors.
content.location: Terrorist is the very center of hidden wall the tallest most prominent line. The start is shared with Slabsters Direct. Lower off the anchors. Two Drilled holes at the bottom.

content.description: The Crux is the Whining crux. At the last bolt of the Whining move right to a bolt then trend straight up. This nice addition to the whining by Matt Stark is very fun.
content.location: start same as whining. Rappel or lower from anchors.

content.description: Crux is pulling the fin like roof and getting up the route. very sustained climbing. The Start is cruxy as well.
content.protection: Bolts and one piece of gear at the roof. Anchors
content.location: Right of Pathway To Extinction. Bolt on big Flake is the start.Stick clip! Lower off anchors of rappel.

content.description: Passing the first bolt to get to the second bolt.
content.location: center right of Hidden Wall. Left of Terrorist right of Toxic Shock.

content.description: There are thin feet for the first half of this route but search and you shall find great jugs most of the way up the corner system. The crux is probably slapping your way through a large flake feature. Figure out the knee bar at the flake or just power through the steep section to the anchors.
content.location: Right of Dixie Fury. Left of The Terrorist. It starts on a slabby section in the middle of the Hidden Wall.

content.description: Start is just right of the Slabsters Lament. Stick clip the first bolt on the blank looking face. Climb hard reachy moves to the second bolt. Then trend left and up to the overhang of slabsters lament and finish on slabsters.
content.location: middle of hidden wall.Just right of Slabsters Lament. And the start of the Terrorist.

content.description: Fun little start up a crack-y feature, to stand on a good ledge, then over a tricky roof, and easy dirty final scramble
content.protection: Four bolts, with anchors at top
content.location: To the right of Toxic Shock, starting on the large, flat ledge; the same start leads to Pteranodon (left at the ledge 15 feet up), Not See (right at that ledge, stay right at the roof), and Freuhlein (right at the ledge and left over the roof)

content.description: Crux is a little boulder problem that pulls the roof. Remember the heel hook.
content.protection: 2 bolts. Anchor consists of 1 bolt and a chain.
content.location: Second bolted line from the far left. Start was on the face with a high foot. Rap down.

content.description: Pumpy climb combining two 11s but bypassing each of their cruxes.

Crus is pulling the roof. Start on Elastic Rebound Theory and move right to the roof. Good steep climbing and pumpy. Finish to Elastic Rebounds Anchors. This route has also been done starting on the Whining.
content.location: The Route is the roof between The Whining and Elastic Rebound Theory.

content.description: Fun climbing through good holds to the roof. Launch out the roof and pull into the easier face. A few long(ish) moves lead to a nice corner and anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts, a #1 or #2 for the last bit between the fifth bolt and the anchors.
content.location: Right of Top That, Left of The Whining and Dixie Fury. Starts at obvious chalked up flakes.

climbs.name: Dixie Fury
climbs.fa: Doug Reed, linkup FA Sam Stephens

content.description:
Climb up the concave face to the short roof crack and pull the bulge. Follow  shiny bolts to anchors. I left a quick link and a biner on the anchor for lowering and rapping, please leave them for others to use.

Watch for rotten rock through the bulge,  this will clean up with traffic. Rumor is is that the big block directly below the climb fell out of the climb at some point. This may be the reason for the rotten rock above the bulge.

After getting some more information on Dixie Fury, it seems it originally ended after the roof. Following the Stark Whining extension to the top created a new link up and a longer full value pitch.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear through the roof, then follow the 4 bolts on Stark Whining to anchors. It's possible to back up the first bolt with a cam.

content.description: Getting past the fisrt bolt is the crux. Very small holds bad feet for the crux. Hard second bolt clip. Can stick clip second bolt if your not brave enough.
content.location: Next to last bolted line on the right side of Hidden Walls main wall. Lower or rappel off anchors.

content.description: Crux is pulling over the little roof. Everything is there you just have to look for it.
content.protection: 1 bolt. Anchor consists of 1 bolt and a chain.
content.location: Far left of hidden wall up on a slab, first bolted line there. Rap down. Start on the left side of the small roof.

content.description:
Anthrax Whining or Anthrax Elastic Anthrax Pagean.

There are three ways to start this route and make it totally different. The original way is Whining to the anchor and then up and left to the arete with the bolt. Heady runout route on the upper part which makes it Anthrax.
content.protection: bolts any gear you can find.
